did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: St. John's Episcopal Church of Clifton Springs records, 1866-1891.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: St. John's Episcopal Church of Clifton Springs (Manchester, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Two church registers containing a church history and records of communicants, individual families, baptisms, confirmations, marriages, burials and offerings.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The church was organized in 1806. In 1812 church activity declined and religious services were held infrequently until 1866 when Reverend William B. Edson revived the church. A new wood church in the Gothic style was built in approximately 1868 and called St. John's Chapel. In 1874 the parish joined with the convention of New York. By 1881 a new church was built.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Two church registers containing a church history and records of communicants, individual families, baptisms, confirmations, marriages, burials and offerings.
